oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Aerial photograph of interstate construction in North Nashville, ca. 1968.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Aerial photograph of interstate construction in North Nashville, looking west, circa 1968, taken by Metro Photographer William M. King. Photograph shows construction of a bridge across the Cumberland River as part of road work for I-265. The interchange of I-265 with I-65 and I-24 can be seen at the bottom of the image while the body of water in the top right is Bush Lake. Forms part of the Nashville Room Historic Photographs Collection. 1 photograph : b & w ; 8 x 10 in.
In 2000, Interstate 265 ceased to exist, and was redesignated as part of Interstate 65. The land on the top half of the image later became the eastern part of the MetroCenter development.
